text:
Hi all! the "Use webhooks with HubSpot workflows" page has been updated, following the rollout of operations hub. <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows>
Seems like webhooks will not be there anymore for marketing and sales enterprise, is it true?
By opening a new testing portal it's still there, so i don't know what to think about it.
If confirmed, this is a major rollback on licensing, i'm pretty confused.
Can someone help?
I would very much like to know about this?

Checked internally.  If you had it before, you will continue to have access to it, but new accounts will need ops hub pro for this feature going forward.  
Cc <@U01SJJ8EBFC> if more clarification is needed :grin:

This is not a very well planned rollout. We've been using custom code automations for 6 months. Now we find out it's part of a new product that we have to pay for?

Not happy.
It would be great if there was a private channel for the betas to interact with other users on betas or to talk to the dev & product teams responsible for betas.

<@UD53A9UUR> is there an official way of saying this that I can share with our team, so we can assess what we need to say with future clients and builds? can someone there point us in the right direction?
Hey Arlo, is there a specific beta you have feedback or questions on? We do have some channels for betas that are running but not for all of them.
tangentially, itâ€™d be super cool to know *what* betas are running - there may be some that are useful for some of us that we may just not know about :slightly_smiling_face:
AJ, I am in custom quotes beta right now
